definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: I think I like this new look.
I wonder who coined that phrase.
sentences.chinese: 不知是谁新造了那个说法。

sentences.english: The government says a new dam is now ready in case of a 2nd spill.
sentences.chinese: 政府表示已经新造了一座大坝以防止毒水再次泄漏。

sentences.english: People on shore greeted the new 10,000 liner by waving their arms as it was getting up.
sentences.chinese: 当新造的万吨巨轮驶近时，岸上的人们挥臂欢迎。

sentences.english: People on shore greeted the new 10, 000 toner by waving their arms as she was getting up.
sentences.chinese: 当新造的万吨轮驶近时，岸上的人们挥臂欢迎。

sentences.english: Are you a new crea¬tion in Christ?
sentences.chinese: 你是否已在基督里成为新造的人？

sentences.english: Burgher's wife said she likes his new look.
sentences.chinese: 伯格的老婆说她喜欢他的新造型。

sentences.english: Whoa, Spidey, love the new outfit.
sentences.chinese: 哇，蜘蛛人，我超爱你的新造型。

sentences.english: Whats more, there is new sandy beach and outdoor gym.
sentences.chinese: 此外，这里还有新造的沙滩和室外运动场。

sentences.english: Have you become a new creature in Christ?
sentences.chinese: 你成为基督新造的人了吗？

sentences.english: A newly-coined word has come into appearance in magazines.
sentences.chinese: 杂志上已有一个新造的词出现。

sentences.english: What do you think about my new out fit?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我的新造型如何？

sentences.english: The second kind of newly-coined words is formed by the extension of word meanings.
sentences.chinese: 第二种新造词主要是通过词义的引申而形成的。

definition: to repair/to refurbish/to renovate/to refit/to mend/to rebuild
to arrange in order/to compile/to prepare (a budget, project etc)
Hong Kong LRT (Light Rail Transit) (abbr. for 輕便鐵路|轻便铁路)
public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state
to separate off/to hive off/a demerger
